name: Bellsprout
flavorText: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

name: Weepinbell
flavorText: The leafy parts act as cutters for slashing foes. It spits a fluid that dissolves everything.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Victreebel
flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned, Confused, and Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Petilil
flavorText: Although the leaves on its head are bitter enough to cause dizziness, they provide relief from weariness—even more so when boiled.
Attack1Text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Lilligant
flavorText: No matter how much time and money is spent raising it, its flowers are the most beautiful when they bloom in the wild.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Phantump
flavorText: These Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died in the forest. Their cries sound like eerie screams.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Trevenant
flavorText: This Pokémon is said to devour anyone daring to ravage the forest. To the creatures dwelling in the forest, it offers great kindness.
Attack1Text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 30 damage for each Trainer card you find there.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

name: Wimpod
flavorText: This Pokémon is a coward. As it desperately dashes off, the flailing of its many legs leaves a sparkling clean path in its wake.
Attack1Text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Golisopod
flavorText: With a flashing slash of its giant sharp claws, it cleaves seawater—or even air—right in two.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-GX or a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 70 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Victini
flavorText: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all results of those coin flips and begin flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

name: Litwick
flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Lampent
flavorText: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

name: Chandelure
flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon to another Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: It beats its wings together to create fire. As it moves in the steps of its beautiful dance, it bathes opponents in intense flames.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Fire Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Salandit
flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

name: Salazzle
flavorText: For some reason, only females have been found. It creates a reverse harem of male Salandit that it lives with.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Burned and Poisoned.
Attack1Text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Turtonator
flavorText: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Turtonator-GX
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Alolan Sandshrew
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Alolan Sandshrew
flavorText: It lives on snowy mountains. Its steel shell is very hard—so much so, it can't roll its body up into a ball.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

name: Alolan Sandslash
flavorText: Fleeing a volcanic eruption, it settled on a snowy mountain. As it races through the snowfields, it sends up a spray of snow.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may draw a card.
Attack1Text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Alolan Vulpix
flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Alolan Vulpix
flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Tentacool
flavorText: They can be found lying dehydrated on beaches, but they are often still alive. When soaked in water, they will revive.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't be healed during your opponent's next turn.

name: Tentacruel
flavorText: Normally, it has 80 poisonous tentacles. The longer one has been alive, the fewer tentacles it will have.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Politoed
flavorText: They gather on moonlit nights to form a large chorus. Their cries sound angry and not at all pleasant, but they are certainly distinctive.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Poliwag, a Poliwhirl, and a Poliwrath, and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

name: Delibird
flavorText: Although it naturally prefers colder locales, Delibird in Alola seem able to withstand the heat to a certain extent.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, you may search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Carvanha
flavorText: Each school has its own territory. Any intruders are mercilessly attacked with fangs bared.

name: Sharpedo
flavorText: It pursues its prey at speeds of 75 mph and finishes them off with fangs that can crush iron. It is known as the bully of the sea.

name: Wailmer
flavorText: It loves to startle people. It fills itself up with seawater and plays by bouncing around like a ball.

name: Wailord
flavorText: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Water Pokémon.

name: Snorunt
flavorText: Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in Alola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt live will be prosperous for generations to come.

name: Glalie
flavorText: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Vanillite
flavorText: Born of an icicle, this Pokémon uses its frosty breath to make ice crystals, causing snow to fall.
Attack1Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Vanillish
flavorText: Hot days cause its body to melt. It can be restored by refreezing it, but the process leaves its body slightly warped.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Fighting Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Vanilluxe
flavorText: Each of its two heads has a brain, and when they are in agreement, it attacks its enemies by exhaling a violent blizzard.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: You may discard 2 Water Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Alomomola
flavorText: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
Attack1Text: Put a Basic Pokémon from either player's discard pile onto its owner's Bench.

name: Wishiwashi
flavorText: When it's in trouble, its eyes moisten and begin to shine. The shining light attracts its comrades, and they stand together against their enemies.
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch this Pokémon with a Wishiwashi-GX in your hand. Any attached cards, damage counters, Special Conditions, turns in play, and any other effects remain on the new Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Wishiwashi-GX
Attack2Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Mareanie
flavorText: It plunges the poison spike on its head into its prey. When the prey has weakened, Mareanie deals the finishing blow with its 10 tentacles.
Attack1Text: Put a Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.

name: Alolan Geodude
flavorText: Its body is a magnetic stone. Iron sand attaches firmly to the portions of its body that are particularly magnetic.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

name: Alolan Graveler
flavorText: Its preferred food is dravite. After it has eaten this mineral, crystals form inside the Pokémon, rising to the surface of part of its body.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
Attack2Text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Alolan Golem
flavorText: It fires rocks charged with electricity. Even if the rock isn't fired that accurately, just grazing an opponent will cause numbness and fainting.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin for each Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 less damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

name: Helioptile
flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Heliolisk
flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
Attack2Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Vikavolt-GX
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped bright yellow nectar. Its bright, cheerful dance melts the hearts of its enemies.
Attack1Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Pom-Pom Punch attack's base damage is 100.

name: Tapu Koko-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Slowpoke
flavorText: Its long tail often breaks off. It doesn't really feel any pain, though, and the tail grows back, so Slowpoke isn't particularly bothered.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Slowbro
flavorText: It spaces out while gazing at the sea. With Shellder's poison flowing through its body, it becomes even spacier.
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon is Burned or Poisoned, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Trubbish
flavorText: Unsanitary places are what they like best. They can be spotted in Alola, often with Grimer in hot pursuit.
Attack1Text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Garbodor
flavorText: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Item card in your opponent's discard pile.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Garbodor
flavorText: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you'll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage for each Item card in your opponent's discard pile.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Gothita
flavorText: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Gothorita
flavorText: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Gothitelle
flavorText: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
Attack1Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the new Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This Oricorio relaxes by swaying gently. This increases its psychic energy, which it then fires at its enemies.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Oricorio
flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped purple nectar. Its elegant, attractive dance will send the minds and hearts of its enemies to another world.
Attack1Text: For each Pokémon in your opponent's discard pile, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: If there is no Stadium card in play, this attack does nothing.

name: Toxapex-GX
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

name: Mimikyu
flavorText: Its actual appearance is unknown. A scholar who saw what was under its rag was overwhelmed by horror and died of the shock.
Attack1Text: Draw 2 cards.
Attack2Text: If your opponent's Pokémon used an attack that isn't a GX attack during their last turn, use it as this attack.

name: Dhelmise
flavorText: Swinging its massive anchor, it can KO Wailord in a single blow. What appears to be green seaweed is actually its body.
Ability1Text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

name: Tapu Lele-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Tapu Lele-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Lunala
flavorText: It is said to be a female evolution of Cosmog. When its third eye activates, away it flies to another world.
Attack1Text: This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Move all Energy from this Pokémon to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

name: Machop
flavorText: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Machop
flavorText: It loves working out. As it gazes at its muscles, which continue to swell day by day, it becomes more and more dedicated to its training.

name: Machoke
flavorText: As a result of its continual workouts, it has developed tremendous power. It uses that power to help people with their work.
Ability1Text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Pokémon by your opponent's attacks. Your opponent's attacks and Abilities can't put damage counters on your Benched Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Machamp
flavorText: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
Attack1Text: This attack does 80 more damage for each Prize card your opponent took on their last turn.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

name: Sudowoodo
flavorText: To avoid attack, it mimics a tree. It will run off if splashed with water, which it hates.
Ability1Text: Your opponent can't have more than 4 Benched Pokémon. If they have 5 or more Benched Pokémon, they discard Benched Pokémon until they have 4 Pokémon on the Bench. If more than one effect changes the number of Benched Pokémon allowed, use the smaller number.

name: Gligar
flavorText: It usually clings to cliffs. When it spots its prey, it spreads its wings and glides down to attack.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Gliscor
flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has no damage counters on it before this attack does damage, this attack does nothing.

name: Nosepass
flavorText: The magnet in Nosepass's nose provides an unerring compass, making it an excellent partner for Trainers going on a journey.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

name: Barboach
flavorText: Its two whiskers provide a sensitive radar. Even in muddy waters, it can detect its prey's location.

name: Whiscash
flavorText: A glutton that devours anything that moves, it quietly lurks at the bottom of swamps, lying in wait for prey.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Discard the top 3 cards of your deck. This attack does 100 damage for each Energy card you discarded in this way.

name: Pancham
flavorText: It grows up imitating the behavior of Pangoro, which it looks up to as a leader.
Attack1Text: This attack does 10 less damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

name: Rockruff
flavorText: It's considered to be a good Pokémon for beginners because of its friendliness, but its disposition grows rougher as it grows up.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Lycanroc-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Mudbray
flavorText: The mud stuck to Mudbray's hooves enhances its grip and its powerful running gait.
Attack1Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

name: Mudsdale
flavorText: It spits a mud that provides resistance to both wind and rain, so the walls of old houses were often coated with it.
Attack1Text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 60 more damage.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

name: Minior
flavorText: It eats dust in the atmosphere. The composition of the dust determines the color of its core.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This Pokémon is Knocked Out.

name: Murkrow
flavorText: They awaken at dusk and take wing in the twilight, leading to the expression, "Get home before the Murkrow fly."
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

name: Honchkrow
flavorText: A single cry from this nocturnal Pokémon, and more than a hundred of its Murkrow cronies will assemble.
Attack1Text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on that Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Sableye
flavorText: It's a fiend for gemstones, so it stalks Carbink. Unfortunately, Gabite almost always grabs them first.
Attack1Text: Your opponent can't play any Supporter cards from their hand during their next turn.

name: Absol
flavorText: Long ago, superstitions were spread about it, saying it brought disaster. This fed a hatred of it, and it was driven deep into the mountains.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 4 cards of either player's deck and put them back in any order.
Attack2Text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

name: Pangoro
flavorText: It boasts superb physical strength. Those who wish to become Pangoro's Trainer have no choice but to converse with their fists.
Attack1Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

name: Beldum
flavorText: Its cells are all magnets. It uses magnetism to communicate with others of its kind.
Attack1Text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Metang
flavorText: When two Beldum link together, their psychic power is doubled. Their intelligence, however, remains unchanged.
Attack2Text: Discard a Metal Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Metagross-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic or Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Probopass
flavorText: It radiates such a powerful magnetic field that nearby electrical appliances become unusable.
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

name: Solgaleo
flavorText: It is said to live in another world. The intense light it radiates from the surface of its body can make the darkest of nights light up like midday.
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: This Pokémon can't use Fangs of the Sunne during your next turn.

name: Clefairy
flavorText: Its adorable behavior and appearance make it popular with men and women, young and old. Its numbers are few, however.
Attack2Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

name: Clefable
flavorText: They don't like to reveal themselves in front of people. They live quietly in packs deep in the mountains.
Attack1Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Meteor Mash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Cottonee
flavorText: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

name: Whimsicott
flavorText: It rides on the wind and slips into people's homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out during your next turn, take 2 more Prize cards.

name: Sylveon-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Sylveon-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Comfey
flavorText: It attaches flowers to its highly nutritious vine. This revitalizes the flowers, and they give off an aromatic scent.
Ability1Text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Fairy Energy attached to it can't be affected by any Special Conditions. Remove any Special Conditions affecting those Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Your opponent draws a card.

name: Goomy
flavorText: The weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, it's unable to breathe if its skin dries out, so it sticks to shady places.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If head, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Sliggoo
flavorText: It has trouble drawing a line between friends and food. It will calmly try to melt and eat even those it gets along well with.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Sliggoo and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Goodra
flavorText: An amazingly friendly Pokémon, but if left to itself, loneliness overcomes it, and it oozes gooey tears.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

name: Drampa
flavorText: It has a compassionate personality, but if it is angered, it will completely destroy its surroundings with its intense breath.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Move an Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Jangmo-o
flavorText: It expresses its feelings by smacking its scales. Metallic sounds echo through the tall mountains where Jangmo-o lives.
Ability1Text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Hakamo-o
flavorText: It leaps at its prey with a courageous shout. Its scaly punches tear its opponents to shreds.

name: Kommo-o-GX
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Chansey
flavorText: The eggs laid by Chansey are rich in nutrients and a favorite food of many Pokémon.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

name: Blissey
flavorText: Even the most ferocious Pokémon become calm when they eat Blissey's egg, which is said to be filled with happiness.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may heal 80 damage from your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

name: Taillow
flavorText: It has a gutsy spirit that makes it bravely take on tough foes. It flies in search of warm climates.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

name: Swellow
flavorText: If its two tail feathers are standing at attention, it is proof of good health. It soars elegantly in the sky.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: If this Pokémon used Agility during your last turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

name: Castform
flavorText: It changes its form depending on the weather. Changes in the temperature or humidity appear to affect its cellular structure.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 2 Stadium cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Rayquaza
flavorText: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.
Attack1Text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Patrat
flavorText: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.
Attack1Text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

name: Watchog
flavorText: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.
Attack1Text: Look at the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck, discard 1 of them, and put the other card back.
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

name: Fletchling
flavorText: This amiable Pokémon is easy to train. But when battle is joined, it shows its ferocious side.
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Fletchinder
flavorText: From its beak, it fires embers at its prey. Once it has caught them, it grills them at high heat before feasting upon them.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Talonflame
flavorText: Its favorite foods are Wingull and Pikipek. It attacks with a powerful kick and grasps them firmly in its talons.
Attack1Text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack2Text: Put all Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

name: Stufful
flavorText: Despite its adorable appearance, when it gets angry and flails about, its arms and legs could knock a pro wrestler sprawling.

name: Bewear
flavorText: This immensely dangerous Pokémon possesses overwhelming physical strength. Its habitat is generally off-limits.
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may draw 3 cards.
Attack1Text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

name: Komala
flavorText: It is born asleep, and it dies asleep. All its movements are apparently no more than the results of it tossing and turning in its dreams.
Ability1Text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever you attach an Energy from your hand to it, it is now Asleep.
Attack1Text: This attack can be used if this Pokémon is Asleep. If it is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

name: Drampa-GX
Attack1Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If your Benched Pokémon have any damage counters on them, this attack does 70 more damage.

name: Turtonator-GX
Attack1Text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 8 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Alolan Ninetales-GX
Attack1Text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Wishiwashi-GX
Attack2Text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

name: Vikavolt-GX
Attack1Text: Attach an Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

name: Tapu Koko-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may move any number of Lightning Energy from your other Pokémon to this Pokémon. If you do, switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Toxapex-GX
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.
Attack2Text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 10 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

name: Tapu Lele-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
Attack1Text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Attack2Text: Heal all damage from 2 of your Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Lycanroc-GX
Ability1Text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack does 50 damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Metagross-GX
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Psychic or Metal Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Pokémon.
Attack1Text: This Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer during your next turn.
Attack2Text: Search your deck for up to 5 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

name: Sylveon-GX
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

name: Kommo-o-GX

Attack2Text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

Attack2Text: Put 3 cards from your discard pile into your hand. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
